title: Exploring Cell Structures: Game-Based Mobile Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic biological terminology and digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Short-term course for enhancing life science assistant job competencies in vocational training institutions. Gamified mobile learning improves practical understanding of cellular structures

learning_goals: Students can explain the names and functions of eight major cell organelles with 80% accuracy through game-based activities.
Learners simulate cellular components and their interactions in digital game interfaces to construct models applicable to real biological phenomena.
Participants can explain the cell division process and energy production mechanisms step-by-step through in-game quizzes.

resources: Custom Digital Board Games Based on Google Sheets
Mobile Learning Management System (LMS) Access Permissions

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
